content.text: JavaScript is the programming language of the web. It can update and change both HTML and CSS, and it can calculate, manipulate, and validate data.
The most common use of JavaScript is to dynamically modify HTML content using innerHTML.

content.text: JavaScript was invented by Brendan Eich in 1995. It became an ECMA standard in 1997. ECMA-262 is the official standard name. ECMAScript is the official name of the language.
JavaScript and Java are completely different languages, both in concept and design.
